mediaEmbedded.synopsis:
Key points:
Kerr currently leads the WSL Golden Boot race with nine goals in eight games
She signed a two-year contract extension last week, keeping her at Chelsea until mid-2024
Chelsea and Barcelona dominate FIFA's Best Women's Player short-list, with four players each

mediaEmbedded.title: FIFA's Women's World Cup Twitter account tweets the short-list for FIFA's The Best Women's Award. The tweet reads: "Nominees: The Best FIFA Women’s Player. Stina Blackstenius, Aitana Bonmatí, Lucy Bronze, Magdalena Eriksson, Caroline Graham Hansen, Pernille Harder, Jenni Hermoso, Ji Soyun, Sam Kerr, Vivianne Miedema, Alexia Putellas, Christine Sinclair, Ellen White."

mediaFeatured.caption: How many more backflips must Sam Kerr do before she wins FIFA's Best Women's Player award?
mediaFeatured.title: Sam Kerr does a backflip

synopsis: Matildas star Sam Kerr sees her recent form rewarded, with a nomination for FIFA's Best Women's Player award.

synopsisAlt.lg: Matildas star Sam Kerr sees her recent form rewarded, with a nomination for FIFA's Best Women's Player award.
synopsisAlt.sm: Matildas star Sam Kerr sees her recent form rewarded, with a nomination for FIFA's Best Women's Player award.

children.content: Matildas and Chelsea striker Sam Kerr has been nominated for FIFA's Best Women's Player award in recognition of her recent goal-scoring form for club and country.
[Sam Kerr FIFA key points]
It is the Australia captain's fifth consecutive nomination.
She is the only Australian nominated in any of the categories in the annual FIFA awards.
Kerr has led the line for Chelsea since joining the club in 2019, winning the Women's Super League Golden Boot award in her first full season after scoring 21 goals in 22 games.
She was crucial in Chelsea's domestic league cup double, as well as helping them reach last year's Champions League final, which they lost to Barcelona 4-0.

At national team level, Kerr was key in the Matildas' historic fourth-placed finish at the Tokyo Olympics, scoring six goals. She is now just one goal away from equalling the country's all-time goal-scoring record (50), currently held by Socceroos legend Tim Cahill.
Kerr signed a two-year contract extension with Chelsea last week and repaid the faith by scoring a hat-trick against Birmingham City on Monday.

She is now the outright goal-scoring leader in England's top-flight competition, with nine goals in eight games. Chelsea teammate Fran Kirby and Arsenal's deadly duo of Vivianne Miedema and Kim Little are tied for second with six goals apiece.
[FIFA Best tweet]

If she continues at this pace, Kerr could break the record for most goals scored in a single Women's Super League campaign (22). She has already become just the second player in WSL history to both score and assist more than 10 goals in a calendar year.
However, of the WSL players in the Golden Boot race, only Miedema joins Kerr on the Best Women's Player short-list.

Kirby's absence is particularly noteworthy given the England midfielder was equally important in Chelsea's title-winning run, finishing third on the Golden Boot ladder and equal first for assists. She won the WSL's Player of the 2020/21 Season award in May.

Despite Kirby's absence, Kerr is joined by three other Chelsea teammates -- Sweden's Magdalena Eriksson, Denmark's Pernille Harder and South Korea's Ji So-yun -- on the 13-player short-list for the Best Women's Player Award.
Blues goalkeeper Ann-Katrin Berger and head coach Emma Hayes are also nominated in their respective categories.

Other nominees in Kerr's category include four players from Barcelona's historic treble-winning team (Aitana Bonmati, Caroline Graham Hansen, Jenni Hermoso and Alexia Putellas), two from Manchester City (last year's winner Lucy Bronze and Ellen White), and one each from Swedish Champions BK Häcken (Stina Blackstenius), the NWSL's Portland Thorns (Christine Sinclair), and Arsenal (Vivianne Miedema).
While the shortlists were decided upon by expert panels,
the final award is decided by the public
, with voting to close on December 10.
The three finalists in each category will be announced in early January, with the winners revealed in a virtual ceremony on January 17.

title: Matildas and Chelsea star Sam Kerr nominated for FIFA's Best Women's Player award

titleAlt.lg: Matildas and Chelsea star Sam Kerr nominated for FIFA's Best Women's Player award
titleAlt.md: Matildas captain Sam Kerr nominated for top FIFA gong
titleAlt.sm: Sam Kerr nominated for FIFA Best award.
